docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Hammonia, from Seathampten on the l8th May, arrived at this port yesterday morning. The steamship Indiana, from Liverpool on the 19th inst., arrived at Quebec yesterday. The news by these arrivals is four days later The unusually lengthy passage of the Indiana is explained by the following:

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; LATER FROM INDIA. PASSENGERS AND CREW ALL SAVED. INTERESTING COMMERCIAL NEWS. Destruction by Fire of the Boston Ship Grand Duchess. Arrival of the Hammonia at this Port and the Indian at Quebec. The British ministerial Crisis still in Suspense.

docs.snippet: WHECK OF A BRITISH BACK--HERR CREW BROUGHT TO NEW-YORK.-The Hamburg ship Dorau, Captain MEYER, thirty-two days from Hamburg, With merchandise and 120 passengers, Consigned to E. BECK  KESHARDT, arrived at this port yesterday, having on board the c...
docs.lead_paragraph: WHECK OF A BRITISH BACK--HERR CREW BROUGHT TO NEW-YORK.-The Hamburg ship Dorau, Captain MEYER, thirty-two days from Hamburg, With merchandise and 120 passengers, Consigned to E. BECK KESHARDT, arrived at this port yesterday, having on board the captain and crew (eighteen in number) of the British bark Davenport, Capt. McKenzie, of Plymouth, England, who had been picked up at sea.

docs.snippet: The ship Howadji, of Newburyport, was struck by Lightning on the 3d of November, and entirely destroyed. Her crew were rescued by the ship Gutenberg, of Hamburg, which arrived at this port late last night....
docs.lead_paragraph: The ship Howadji, of Newburyport, was struck by Lightning on the 3d of November, and entirely destroyed. Her crew were rescued by the ship Gutenberg, of Hamburg, which arrived at this port late last night.

docs.snippet: The United States Mail steamer Arago, Captain LINES, arrived yesterday morning from Southampton, with the French and English mails and advices from London to the 21st October. The Arage brings 300 passengers, the usual malls, $220,000 in specie an...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamer Arago, Captain LINES, arrived yesterday morning from Southampton, with the French and English mails and advices from London to the 21st October. The Arage brings 300 passengers, the usual malls, $220,000 in specie and 250 tons merchandise.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; Effect of the Panic on the Manufacturing Towns of Great Britain. TRADE IN FRANCE. CONSOLS UNCHANGED. Wreck of American Vessels. Further Discount Advances in France, England and Hamburg. ARRIVAL OF THE ARAGO. THE FINANCIAL CRISIS ABROAD $220,000 in Specie on Board.

docs.snippet: A dispatch from St. Pierre, Miquelon, dated July 27, staten that the bark Monasco, of Warren, Me., from Gettenburg for New-York, was totally lost near B?nin, Newfoundland, on the 21st inst., together with fifty Swedish steerage passengers. The Cap...
docs.lead_paragraph: A dispatch from St. Pierre, Miquelon, dated July 27, staten that the bark Monasco, of Warren, Me., from Gettenburg for New-York, was totally lost near B?nin, Newfoundland, on the 21st inst., together with fifty Swedish steerage passengers. The Captain and Lis wife, the crew and six passengers were saved. The crew and the six passengers were landed at St. Pierre,

headline.main: Loss of the Bark Monasco, with Fitty Swedish Passengers..

docs.snippet: The loss of the steamship Louisiana, of the New Orleans and Galveston line, has been briefly reported in our telegraphic dispatohes. An extra of the Galveston New8, of the 31st ult., furnishes full details of the catastrophe....
docs.lead_paragraph: The loss of the steamship Louisiana, of the New Orleans and Galveston line, has been briefly reported in our telegraphic dispatohes. An extra of the Galveston New8, of the 31st ult., furnishes full details of the catastrophe.

headline.main: TERRIBLE CALAMITY !; THIRTY-NINE LIVES LOST. Burning of the Steamship Louisiana in the Gulf of Mexico.

docs.snippet: The Wreck at Barnegat. The steamer Roanoke, which arrived on Wednesday, reported a large ship ashore north of Baraegat Inlet, having foremast gone. Capt. JOHN BROWN, the underwriter's agent at Squan, came up yesterday, and brought the particulars ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Wreck at Barnegat. The steamer Roanoke, which arrived on Wednesday, reported a large ship ashore north of Baraegat Inlet, having foremast gone. Capt. JOHN BROWN, the underwriter's agent at Squan, came up yesterday, and brought the particulars concerning the wreek. The ship proves to be the Bremen ship Minerva, WIETING, from Rotterdam,

docs.snippet: On the 20th instant there raged on our coast a furious north gale, which lasted for twenty-four hours, and caused considerable losses and damage among the shipping. Among the disasters figures foremost the shipwreck of the national steamer Iturbid...
docs.lead_paragraph: On the 20th instant there raged on our coast a furious north gale, which lasted for twenty-four hours, and caused considerable losses and damage among the shipping. Among the disasters figures foremost the shipwreck of the national steamer Iturbide, which deeply affected all the inhabitants of Vera Cruz, in whose very sight the catastrophe took place, without being by any possibility able to prevent it.

headline.main: Destructive Hurricane off the Mexican Coast.; TWO WAR VESSELS AND A NEW-YORK BARK WRECKED--NEARLY A HUNDRED LIVES LOST.

docs.snippet: Captain JOHN PETERSON, of the brig Whitehall, already reported abandoned at sea, having arrived in this City, we have obtained the following narrative of the hardships endured by himself and crew before they were rescued from their perilous situat...
docs.lead_paragraph: Captain JOHN PETERSON, of the brig Whitehall, already reported abandoned at sea, having arrived in this City, we have obtained the following narrative of the hardships endured by himself and crew before they were rescued from their perilous situation. The brig Whitehall was formerly the Government Light-ship off Sandy Hock, and was altered into a mug brig for sea service.

headline.main: MAINE ITEMS.; Lose of Brig Whitehall--Sufferings of the Crew--Yankee Grit.
